TopicTitle: KSP auto updated to 1.2.1.xxxx How do I go back to 1.2.0.xxxx?

Articles.Content:
Hello all, I have tried to find this on Steam's community forum to no avail.  Is there a way to roll back my version back to 1.2.0?  I have tried the right click -> properties->Betas-> previous verison thing, but 1.2.0 is not listed as available.  I ask as I just lost my Outer Planets as Kopernicus is not compatible according to KSP AVC.

Any thoughts?

Thanks!

52 minutes ago, smotheredrun said:

not compatible according to KSP AVC

Have you confirmed that it is actually broken? KSP-AVC will flag it as incompatible but the changes in 1.2.1 are minor enough that it may well still work.

On the original question, this is one of many reasons one should always have backups. Also one of the many reasons I don't use Steam.

AVC can be a little overzealous, because it depends on the author to set the version parameter for their mod.  Some mods do allow minor updates to go through without so much as a warning, and some will disable the mod at the slightest hotfix.  You may want to check the patch notes, but chances are there's nothing actually broken.

@Capt. Hunt, @steve_v:

I have seen on the Kopernicus and OPM threads that Kopernicus is "version locked", meaning it won't work until Kopernicus is updated apparently.  I believe that means I'll be out of luck until then....

 

Link:

Have same problem..  Just had Steam auto update before I made a backup of v1.2 and as I play with SVE I am outta luck also until Kopernicus is updated..

I do feel for these modders with the constant update and breaking scenario. I couldn't do it!  

Shame we can't identify and have uploaded the changed files as it was only a 11 MB update...
